title: Magical Mitosis
subject: Science
spec:
Build me an interactive web app to help a learner understand the stages of mitosis, and their importance in growth and repair.

SPECIFICATIONS:
1.  The app should display a single cell. Initially, the cell should be in Interphase (pre-mitosis). The cell should be cartoonish and engaging, similar to the cells in the Amoeba Sisters' video.
2. The user should be able to advance the cell through the different stages of mitosis (Prophase, Metaphase, Anaphase, Telophase) via a 'Next Stage' button.  Each time the button is pressed, the cell should visually transform to represent the next stage. A label should indicate the current stage.
3.  At each stage, a brief (one sentence) description of what's happening within the cell should be displayed.  For example, during Metaphase, the description might read: 'Chromosomes line up in the middle of the cell.'
4.  The app should clearly illustrate the chromosomes within the cell, and show how the chromosomes are duplicated during interphase, and then separated during mitosis
5. Finally, upon reaching Telophase, the app should show that the original cell has divided into two identical daughter cells, each with a complete set of chromosomes. The text 'Identical Daughter Cells!' should be displayed.
6. The UI should be simple and intuitive, focusing on the visual transformation of the cell through the stages. The visual design should be inviting and playful, encouraging exploration.

spec:

spec:

title: How Chords Work
subject: English
spec:
Build me an interactive web app to help a learner understand triads and their inversions.

SPECIFICATIONS:
1.  The app must feature an interactive keyboard. When a key is pressed, the corresponding note should sound.
2.  The app must allow the user to select a root note (C, D, E, F, G, A, or B).  This root note should be displayed clearly. The root note should default to C.
3. The app must allow the user to select a triad type (Major, Minor, Diminished, Augmented). The triad type should be displayed clearly. The triad type should default to Major.

7.  The app must be responsive and work well on both desktop and mobile devices.

title: How to Tie Your Shoes
subject: Arts & Crafts
spec:
The video demonstrates how to tie a shoelace using the bunny ears method. The key idea is to break down the process into manageable steps that can be practiced. 

Build me an interactive web app that reinforces the steps involved in tying a shoelace.

SPECIFICATIONS:
1. The app should display a shoelace tying process as a series of interactive steps.
2. The app should feature two shoelaces that the user can manipulate.
3. The app should have a button for each step in the process, and the user must press the buttons in the correct sequence. When the user presses the correct button, the shoelaces will move to reflect the action. When the user presses the incorrect button, the app should play an error sound and display a message indicating the error.
4. The app must guide the user through these steps:
	*   Grab one lace in each hand, about halfway up the lace, to form a V.
	*   Cross the laces to make an X. One lace will be in front, and the other lace is behind it.
	*   Take the lace that is behind and pull it over the front and put it through the hole.
	*   Take both ends and pull until the X becomes a V again.
	*   Spread the V out.
	*   Take one lace at the halfway point and let it hang on your finger.
	*   Pinch both sides of the lace so it makes a loop around your finger.
	*   Pull your finger out, and you've got an open loop. Hold on to it.
	*   Take the other lace and lay it over your thumb and finger so it's in front of the loop.
	*   Use your finger to send that lace back to the other side.
	*   Now the laces point opposite ways again, and you've made a little hole between your shoe and your thumb.
	*   Poke the lace through the little hole just a little bit, so it makes a loose loop.
	*   Grab both loops at the same time and pull until the knot is tight.
